original: gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / dril bu dang / ba dan la sogs pa shin tu phul du byung ba'i mchod pa'i rnam pas mchod cing /
analyzed: gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / dril bu dang / ba dan la sogs pa shin tu phul du byung ba'i mchod pa'i rnam pas mchod cing /
translated: parasols, victory banners, bells, flags, and so forth.

original: sdig pa bshags par bya'o //
analyzed: sdig pa bshags par bya'o //
translated: Then confess your negative actions.

original: gang zhig skye ba 'di dang / skye ba gzhan rnams su thog ma dang tha ma @77b med pa'i 'khor ba nas 'khor ba'i skye gnas rnams su bdag gi lus dang ngag dang yid kyis kyang sdig pa'i las ci bgyis pa dang / bgyid du stsal ba dang /

translated: Whatever negative actions I have done, caused to be done, or rejoiced in doing with my body, speech, or mind in this life or in other lives, throughout beginningless cyclic existence, in all my births,

original: rjes su yi rang bar bgyis pa de rnams thams cad 'jig rten gsum gyi mgon po bcom ldan 'das spro ba chen po rnams dang / bla ma dang / sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyan sngar so sor bshags par bgyi'o //

translated: I confess all of these in the presence of the protectors of the three worlds, the Blessed Ones, the greatly joyful ones, the gurus, the buddhas, and the bodhisattvas.

original: cho ga 'dis so sor bshags shing slar yang mi byed pa'i sdom pa 'dzin cing bsod nams la rjes su yi rang bar bya ste /
analyzed: cho ga 'dis so sor bshags shing slar yang mi byed pa'i sdom pa 'dzin cing bsod nams la rjes su yi rang bar bya ste /
translated: By this ritual, I confess, and I take the vow not to commit them again. I rejoice in the merit.

original: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dang / rang rgyal dang / nyan thos rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / gang zhig 'jig rten gsum na mchis pa'i dge ba thams cad la rjes su yi rang ngo //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dang / rang rgyal dang / nyan thos rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / gang zhig 'jig rten gsum na mchis pa'i dge ba thams cad la rjes su yi rang ngo //
translated: I rejoice in all the virtue that exists in the three worlds, in the perfect buddhas, the solitary buddhas, the hearers, the bodhisattvas, and all others.

original: de'i rjes su dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su 'gro bar bya ste /
analyzed: de'i rjes su dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su 'gro bar bya ste /
translated: After that, I go for refuge to the Three Jewels.

original: rkang gnyis rnams kyi mchog sangs rgyas la skyabs su mchi'o //
analyzed: rkang gnyis rnams kyi mchog sangs rgyas la skyabs su mchi'o //
translated: I go for refuge to the Buddha, the best of humans.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams kyi mchog chos la skyabs su mchi'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams kyi mchog chos la skyabs su mchi'o //
translated: I go for refuge to the Dharma, the best of all that is free from desire.

original: tshogs rnams kyi mchog dge 'dun la skyabs su mchi'o //
analyzed: tshogs rnams kyi mchog dge 'dun la skyabs su mchi'o //
translated: I go for refuge to the Saṅgha, the best of all communities.

original: phyi nas lam la brten pa ni rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa'i lam la bdag gis bsten gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: phyi nas lam la brten pa ni rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa'i lam la bdag gis bsten gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: After that, I will rely on the path, the path taught by the perfect Buddha, and not on any other.

original: de nas gsol ba gdab par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas gsol ba gdab par bya ste /
translated: Then make the following supplication:

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang de'i sras byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams kyang yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' zhing 'khor ba ma stongs kyi bar du sems can gyi don mdzad du gsol /

translated: “May the blessed buddhas and their great bodhisattva sons not pass into parinirvāṇa, but remain and continue to act for the welfare of all beings until saṃsāra is empty.

original: de'i rjes su bskul ma gdab par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i rjes su bskul ma gdab par bya ste /
translated: ” After that, make the following request:

original: rnam pa de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis bla na med pa'i chos gsung bzhin bstan pas gang gis myur du sems can rnams 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho gting mtha' med pa las bsgral du gsol /

translated: “In the same way, may the blessed tathāgatas quickly liberate all beings from the fathomless ocean of saṃsāra by teaching the unsurpassed Dharma.

original: gsol ba btab pa'i rjes su de nas bsod nams yongs su bsngo bar bya'o //
analyzed: gsol ba btab pa'i rjes su de nas bsod nams yongs su bsngo bar bya'o //
translated: After making the request, then one should dedicate the merit.

original: bla na med pa'i mchod pa rnam pa bdun gyis mchod nas gang de bzhin du dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa rnams de bzhin du bdag gis rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa'i mchod pa rnam pa bdun gyis mchod nas gang de bzhin du dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa rnams de bzhin du bdag gis rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar bgyi'o //
translated: Having made the sevenfold offering, one should dedicate the roots of virtue in the same way to perfect enlightenment.

original: yang na bsdus nas bla na med pa'i mchod pa rnam pa bdun gsungs te /
analyzed: yang na bsdus nas bla na med pa'i mchod pa rnam pa bdun gsungs te /
translated: Or else, having summarized, the sevenfold offering is taught.

analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'di bklag par bya'o //
translated: This verse should be recited:🔽Whatever bad actions I have done

analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid kyis gang bgyis pa'i //
translated: with my body, speech, or mind,

translated: I go for refuge to the Three Jewels,

translated: The fathers of all beings do not pass into nirvana,

translated: The Dharma that puts an end to doubt,

translated: O, O, you of great power, please teach it.

translated: I dedicate it all to perfect enlightenment.

original: rgyal ba rnams dang de yi sras //

translated: The victors and their sons,

original: bdag dang 'gro ba'i bla ma la //🔽bdag gis dngos po thams cad ni //
analyzed: bdag dang 'gro ba'i bla ma la // bdag gis dngos po thams cad ni //
translated: The gurus of myself and beings,🔽With all of these things

translated: I offer everything to them all.

translated: Having made offerings with these seven offerings,

translated: Request their departure with oṃ āḥ hūṃ muḥ.

analyzed: de nas tshad med pa bzhi ni byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms kyi mtshan nyid rnams ni 'og nas 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rim pas bsgom par bya'o // de la 'dir byams pas ni sems can thams cad la shin tu phan par byed cing /
translated: Then, the four immeasurables are the characteristics of love, compassion, joy, and equanimity, which should be cultivated in the order to be explained below.

analyzed: bu gcig pa ltar mnyes gshin pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: Here, love is the characteristic of benefiting all sentient beings extremely, like a single child, with a loving mind.

original: snying rje ni ci 'dra na /
analyzed: snying rje ni ci 'dra na /
translated: What is compassion like?

original: gting mtha' med pa'i 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho'i nang du lhung ba'i mtha' yas pa'i sems can gyi khams bdag gis yang dag par gdon par 'dod pa'i bsam pa can no //

translated: It is the intention to completely rescue the infinite realm of sentient beings who have fallen into the fathomless ocean of saṃsāra.

original: yang dga' ba ni ci 'dra na /
analyzed: yang dga' ba ni ci 'dra na /
translated: What is joy like?

original: khams gsum na gnas pa'i sems can rnams kyang gang zhig legs par spyod pa de rnams la de'i longs spyod kyi dbang phyug la sogs pa rnams la sems dga' ba'o //
analyzed: khams gsum na gnas pa'i sems can rnams kyang gang zhig legs par spyod pa de rnams la de'i longs spyod kyi dbang phyug la sogs pa rnams la sems dga' ba'o //
translated: It is the joy of the mind towards the enjoyments, lordship, and so forth of those sentient beings who dwell in the three realms and who engage in good conduct.

original: gang 'dir btang snyoms ni khong khro ba dang / rjes su brtse ba dag nges par bcings shing phan pa dang / gnod par byed pa spangs nas sems can rnams la mchog tu phan par spyod pa ste /
analyzed: gang 'dir btang snyoms ni khong khro ba dang / rjes su brtse ba dag nges par bcings shing phan pa dang / gnod par byed pa spangs nas sems can rnams la mchog tu phan par spyod pa ste /
translated: Here, equanimity is the binding of anger and affection, and the practice of the highest benefit for sentient beings, having abandoned the doing of benefit and harm.

original: tshad med pa bzhi sgom zhing /
analyzed: tshad med pa bzhi sgom zhing /
translated: Having meditated on the four immeasurables,

original: de nas chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin yongs su dag par bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin yongs su dag par bsam par bya'o //
translated: one should then contemplate the complete purity of the nature of all phenomena.

original: chos thams cad 'di bzhin du rang bzhin ngo bo nyid med cing yongs su dag pa'o zhes pa la sogs pa mngon du bya'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad 'di bzhin du rang bzhin ngo bo nyid med cing yongs su dag pa'o zhes pa la sogs pa mngon du bya'o //
translated: “All phenomena are like this, without inherent nature and completely pure.”

original: @78b 'di bzhin du chos thams cad rang bzhin yongs su dag cing /
analyzed: @78b 'di bzhin du chos thams cad rang bzhin yongs su dag cing /
translated: In this way, all phenomena are completely pure by nature.

original: aom sva bh'a wa shuddha:sarba dharm'a:sva bh'a wa shuddho& ham zhes pa 'dis brtan par bya'o //
analyzed: aom sva bh'a wa shuddha:sarba dharm'a:sva bh'a wa shuddho& ham zhes pa 'dis brtan par bya'o //
translated: “Oṃ svabhāva śuddhāḥ sarvadharmāḥ svabhāva śuddho ’haṃ”

original: chos thams cad rang bzhin yongs su dag pa la gsar du sgrib par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: chos thams cad rang bzhin yongs su dag pa la gsar du sgrib par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If it is asked, “Is it not the case that all phenomena are completely pure by nature, and that they are newly obscured?”

original: bden te / gzhan 'dir 'gyur ba dang mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du gang las 'gyur ba ni 'khor ba'i rgyu 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dri ma sna tshogs pa'i phyir slar yang chos thams cad kyis ji ltar med par 'gyur na /

translated: How could he be nonexistent through all dharmas?

original: khyad par du 'phags pa'i lam bsgom pa des 'gog ste /
analyzed: khyad par du 'phags pa'i lam bsgom pa des 'gog ste /
translated: The path of distinction cultivates cessation.

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis 'gog pa mngon du bya zhes so //
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis 'gog pa mngon du bya zhes so //
translated: Therefore, the Lord said, “One should realize cessation.”

original: de'i phyir na chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig las bskyed pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir na chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig las bskyed pa bzhin no //
translated: Therefore, as stated in the passage beginning, “All dharmas are pure by nature,” and so on, one should cultivate the path of distinction.

original: 'dir mang po smras pas ci zhig bya /🔽chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin yongs su dag pa mngon du bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir mang po smras pas ci zhig bya / chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin yongs su dag pa mngon du bya ba'i phyir /
translated: What is the use of speaking much?🔽In order to realize the pure nature of all dharmas,

original: chos thams cad stong pa nyid do zhes bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa nyid do zhes bsgom par bya'o //
translated: one should cultivate the emptiness of all dharmas.

original: de la 'dir stong pa nyid ni yid tsam gyis de bzhin du 'dir de dang de'i rnam pas bdag nyid snang zhing so sor gsal bar bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'dir stong pa nyid ni yid tsam gyis de bzhin du 'dir de dang de'i rnam pas bdag nyid snang zhing so sor gsal bar bya ste /
translated: Here, emptiness is to be understood as the mere mind appearing in such and such forms, manifesting individually.

original: dper na rmi lam bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rmi lam bzhin no //
translated: It is like a dream.

original: phyi rol du yid kyis gzung ba med de yid kyis so //
analyzed: phyi rol du yid kyis gzung ba med de yid kyis so //
translated: There is no external object apprehended by the mind; it is the mind itself.

original: gzung ba'i dngos po med na 'dzin pa'i yid kyang med do //
analyzed: gzung ba'i dngos po med na 'dzin pa'i yid kyang med do //
translated: When there is no object to be apprehended, there is no apprehending mind either.

analyzed: 'jig rten gsum gyi mi shes pa'i mun pa bcom par gyur nas /
translated: Having conquered the darkness of ignorance in the three worlds,

analyzed: de'i rjes la ri dags kyi mtshan ma dang bral ba'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su thim zhing /

analyzed: med pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi nam mkha' la bzhugs nas /

analyzed: gzhan gyi don mdzad nas 'gro pa rnams kyang bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten dbang phyug gi gzugs su bskyed nas /

analyzed: de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das nang du yang dag par zhugs par gyur te /

translated: All the supreme victors have made offerings to it in the same way, and it should be honored and worshipped in the same way.

original: gzhan dngos grub phra mo smos ci dgos te /
analyzed: gzhan dngos grub phra mo smos ci dgos te /
translated: What need is there to mention other minor accomplishments?

original: nges par 'byung ngo //
